Association: CYP3A5 *3/*3 + *1/*3 is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to CYP3A5 *1/*1.
More Details: "New-onset diabetes after transplantation was seen in 28.6% of patients in the non-expresser group and 12.5% of the intermediate expresser group." zero out of the two *1/*1 ("expressers") had NODAT.

Association: Allele T is not associated with Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension or Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele C.
Genotype TT is associated with decreased risk of Edema when treated with muraglitazar in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype CC.
Genotypes CT + TT are associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: Association with the development of new-onset diabetes after transplantation. All patients received a triple-drug immunosuppressive regimen, consisting of Tac, MMF, and prednisolone. The POR*28 allele (rs1057868; POR*28; A503V) was associated with an increased risk of developing NODAT.

Association: Genotype AA are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes AG + GG.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

Association: Allele T is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to allele C.
More Details: Alleles complemented. "the frequency of the A allele was significantly higher in the PTDM group compared to the control group, whereas the G allele was more prevalent in the control group"

Association: Genotypes CC + CT is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with liver transplantation as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: When looking at DONOR genotype. New-onset diabetes mellitus (NODM). OR value is per C allele. Significant results were also seen when looking at donor+recipient genotype (p=0.005, OR=2.466), but recipient genotype alone was only significant in univariate analysis when comparing CC vs TT genotype (p=0.034, OR=1.94).

Association: Genotypes AA + AG are associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype GG.
More Details:
Association with the development of new-onset diabetes after transplantation. All patients received a triple-drug immunosuppressive regimen, consisting of Tac,
MMF, and prednisolone.

Association: Allele A is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with cyclosporine or tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to allele G.
More Details: This was more significant in the subset of tacrolimus-treated patients but not significant in the smaller subset of cyclosporine-treated patients.

Association: Genotypes CC + CT is associated with decreased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype TT.
More Details:
"The CYP3A4*1B
allele was significantly associated to a lower occurrence of newonset diabetes (OR = 0.60, 95% CI: 0.38–0.94, p = 0.026)." Mapped CYP3A4*1B to rs2740574C and CYP3A4*1 to rs2740574T.

Association: Allele G is associated with statin-related myopathy when treated with atorvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus and Hypertension as compared to allele C.
More Details: Alleles complemented to plus chromosomal strand. While study looked at 76 subjects with severe statin-associated muscle symptoms and 50 statin-tolerant controls, then studied exam sequencing data in RYR1 and CACNA1S, most variants considered pathogenic were at very low frequency and were reported as case series not with statistics for overall risk.

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: Treatment success was defined as 1) achieving HbA1c <7 % and 2) absolute reduction in HbAlc after 6-months of metformin therapy. The relationships between genotypes and outcomes were evaluated using multivariate logistic and linear models.

Association: Genotype CT is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: The subjects had kidney transplants.  There were not enough TT to draw a conclusion.  Haplotypes with rs3792267 and rs3842570 were also important.

Association: Genotype CC is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with Thiazides, plain as compared to genotypes CT + TT.
More Details: Referred to as GNB3 C825T. The study compared  CC genotype OR; 2.01 (1.49-2.72) p<0.05, with CT/TT genotype OR; 1.36 (1.01-1.84) p<0.05, and showed that carriers of the CC genotype had a significantly higher increased risk.

Association: Genotypes AC + CC is associated with decreased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype AA.
More Details: using computational model-based approaches and genetic, demographic, and long-term HbA1c data from 1,056 patients.

Association: Allele C is not associated with decreased hemoglobin levels when exposed to glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: Fasting blod sample was drawn to determine hemoglobin (A1c) levels. HbA1c was determined with immunoturbodimetric hemolytic automated analysis/.

Association: Genotypes AA + AC is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with Thiazides, plain as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: Referred to in the study as A1166C. The study compared AA/ AC genotype OR;1.79 (1.43-2.23) p<0.05, to the CC genotype OR; 0.63 (0.28-1.4) p<0.05 and showed that carriers of the A allele have a significantly higher increased risk.

Association: CYP3A5 *1/*1 + *1/*3 is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to CYP3A5 *3/*3.
More Details: No difference in allele frequencies was found between children who developed post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM) and those who did not.

Association: Allele A is not associated with Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension and Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele T.

Allele A is not associated with Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension and Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele G.
Genotypes CC + CT are associated with increased exposure to rosuvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus and Hypercholesterolemia as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: This variant affected rosuvastatin concentration significantly and potentially affect serum levels of pro-inflammatory and pro-angiogenic markers.

Association: Genotype GG is associated with increased response to fenofibrate in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CC + CG.
More Details: Patients with the GG genotype were more likely to be a "high responder" to fenofibrate treatment. High responders were classified as having a relative reduction of triglyceride levels > 30% after at least 3 years of fenofibrate treatment. Patients with less than or equal to 30% reduction in triglyceride levels were classified as "low responders".

Association: Genotype AA is associated with decreased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes AG + GG.
Genotypes AG + GG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype AA.
More Details: No difference in allele frequencies was found between children who developed post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM) and those who did not. The authors note that the cumulative proportion of patients developing PTDM was higher in those who carried the AG and GG genotype and the rs1057868 TT genotype (p=0.012). Please note that alleles have been complemented to the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: Genotype CC are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CG + GG.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

Association: Allele T is associated with statin-related myopathy when treated with atorvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: While study looked at 76 subjects with severe statin-associated muscle symptoms and 50 statin-tolerant controls, then studied exam sequencing data in RYR1 and CACNA1S, most variants considered pathogenic were at very low frequency and were reported as case series not with statistics for overall risk.

Association: Genotypes CT + TT are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).  The TT genotype was associated with a greater decrease in waist circumference as compared to the TC and CC genotypes after pioglitazone therapy (p=0.033).

Association: Genotypes AA + AG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype GG.
More Details: No difference in allele frequencies was found between children who developed post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM) and those who did not.

Association: Genotypes AG + GG are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype AA.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).  The AA genotype was associated with a greater decrease in waist circumference as compared to the AG and GG genotypes after pioglitazone therapy (p=0.019) although the AG and GG genotypes were associated with a greater decrease in fasting insulin as compared to the AA genotype (p=0.03).

Association: Genotypes CT + TT are associated with decreased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: using computational model-based approaches and genetic, demographic, and long-term HbA1c data from 1,056 patients.

Association: Genotypes AA + AG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype GG.
More Details: No difference in allele frequencies was found between children who developed post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM) and those who did not.

Association: Genotypes GT + TT are associated with increased exposure to rosuvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus and Hypercholesterolemia as compared to genotype GG.
More Details: This variant affected rosuvastatin concentration significantly and potentially affect serum levels of pro-inflammatory and pro-angiogenic markers.

Association: Allele A is not associated with Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension and Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele C.
Genotype TT is associated with increased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: as measured by decreased HbA1c. Discovery population (which also received glibenclamide or chinese medicine containing glibenclamide) also saw decreases in hip circumference.

Association: Genotype GG is associated with increased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CC + CG.
More Details: as measured by decreased HbA1c. Discovery population (which also received glibenclamide or Chinese medicine containing glibenclamide) also saw decreases in waist, hip circumference and BMI.

Association: CYP3A5 *1 is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to CYP3A5 *3.
More Details: New-onset diabetes after transplantation (NODAT).

Association: Allele G is associated with decreased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: Treatment success was defined as 1) achieving HbA1c <7 % and 2) absolute reduction in HbAlc after 6-months of metformin therapy. The relationships between genotypes and outcomes were evaluated using multivariate logistic and linear models.

More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

Association: Genotype AA is not associated with response to fenofibrate in people with Diabetes Mellitus.
More Details: Response was assessed by reduction in triglyceride levels after at least 3 years of fenofibrate treatment. "High responders" had a relative reduction of triglyceride levels > 30%, "low responders" had a relative reduction less than or equal to 30%. No significant differences in the percentages of high and low responders were seen between genotypes.

Association: Genotypes CC + CT is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: No difference in allele frequencies was found between children who developed post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM) and those who did not. The authors note that the cumulative proportion of patients developing PTDM was higher in those who carried the TT genotype and the rs1045642 AG or GG genotypes (p=0.012).

Association: Allele G is associated with decreased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when exposed to atenolol or verapamil in people with Hypertension as compared to allele A.
Genotypes AG + GG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in children with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype AA.

Association: Genotype del/del is associated with increased response to benazepril or perindopril in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC + ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/del.
More Details: Patients with the del/del genotype had significantly greater percentage reductions between baseline and 3 months of treatment in urinary excretion of protein and albumin, as compared to those with the remaining genotypes. This indicates a greater response to the antiproteinuric effects of benazepril and perindopril.

Association: Genotype GG is associated with increased risk of Edema when treated with muraglitazar in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: GG and GC genotype as reported in paper

Association: Genotype TT is associated with increased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: using computational model-based approaches and genetic, demographic, and long-term HbA1c data from 1,056 patients.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with increased likelihood of Muscular Diseases when treated with atorvastatin or rosuvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus, Hyperlipidemias, Hypertension or Obesity as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
Genotype GG is associated with decreased risk of Edema when treated with muraglitazar in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: p=0.012 is for GG vs TT

Association: CYP3A4 *1/*18 + *18/*18 are not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to CYP3A4 *1/*1.
More Details: New-onset diabetes after transplantation (NODAT). PharmVar has consolidated CYP3A4*18B under CYP3A4*18 .001

Association: Genotype CC is associated with increased likelihood of Muscular Diseases when treated with atorvastatin or rosuvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus, Hyperlipidemias, Hypertension or Obesity as compared to genotypes CT + TT.
More Details: Authors play down the significance because it was not significant when looking at atorvastatin or rosuvastatin subsets individually.

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: Treatment success was defined as 1) achieving HbA1c <7 % and 2) absolute reduction in HbAlc after 6-months of metformin therapy. The relationships between genotypes and outcomes were evaluated using multivariate logistic and linear models.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele C.
More Details: Hydrochlorothiazide-induced diabetes. Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ)  treatment was defined as exposure to HCTZ with any dose or duration before diagnosis of NOD. The patients are part of the INVEST study with randomized treatment with either an atenolol-based or a verapamil sustained release (SR)-based antihypertensive strategy. Both treatment strategies included the possibility of HCTZ treatment at different steps of the treatment plan for BP control as necessary.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with cyclosporine, sirolimus or tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to allele C.
More Details: The type of Diabetes is termed "NODAT" (New-onset diabetes after transplantation).  Authors state that correction for multiple testing was not done because the SNPs were selected on the basis of biological evidence that they were associated with type 2 Diabetes. 11 polymorphisms were tested, and p shown is uncorrected value.  CT compared to CC: 59% higher odds of NODAT (p = 0.03).  TT vs CC: 92% higher odds of NODAT (p = 0.04).

Association: Genotype GT is associated with decreased likelihood of reaching target cholesterol levels when treated with atorvastatin, cerivastatin, fluvastatin, pravastatin, rosuvastatin or simvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: Odds ratio for failure to reach target TG vs TT = 2.93 (1.61-5.34). Patients who have had at least 2 statin prescriptions.
Drugs: atorvastatin; cerivastatin; fluvastatin; pravastatin; rosuvastatin; simvastatin

Association: Allele A is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
Allele T is not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
Allele A is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele G.

CYP2C9 *2 + *3 is associated with increased risk of Hypoglycemia when treated with glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to CYP2C9 *1.
More Details:
The authors report that the *2 and *3 alleles are not associated with the number of hypoglycemic events per patient over a period of three months when looking at the whole group (N=156). When looking only at patients over 60 however (N=103), the *2 and *3 alleles become significantly associated with an increase in the number of hypoglycemic events per patient. Patients reported blood glucose levels once a week, and if they had signs or symptoms of hypoglycemic events. Hypoglycemia was defined according to the American Diabetes Association symptoms and confirmed by blood glucose measurement of less than 3.9 mmol/l.
Note: the authors genotyped rs1799853 and consider the C allele to be equivalent to *2, and the C allele at rs1057910 to be equivalent to *3.

Association: Allele T is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele A.
More Details: Hydrochlorothiazide-induced diabetes. Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ)  treatment was defined as exposure to HCTZ with any dose or duration before diagnosis of NOD. The patients are part of the INVEST study with randomized treatment with either an atenolol-based or a verapamil sustained release (SR)-based antihypertensive strategy. Both treatment strategies included the possibility of HCTZ treatment at different steps of the treatment plan for BP control as necessary.

Association: Genotypes CC + CT are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

Association: Allele A is associated with decreased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele T.
More Details: Caution: this is a A/T SNP in a gene on the minus chromosomal strand. In the paper association is given for the A (minor) allele, which appears to be already shown on the plus chromosomal strand.

Association: Genotype del/del is associated with increased resistance to captopril in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC + ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/del.
More Details: Patients with the del/del genotype had steeper decline in glomerular filtration rate (GFR) compared to the other genotypes, indicating a decline in renal function.

Association: Allele C is associated with increased response to rosiglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: as measured by HbA1c reduction.

Association: Genotype GG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with cyclosporine or tacrolimus in people with Transplantation as compared to genotypes CC + CG.
More Details: No association with new-onset diabetes after transplantation (NODAT) in solid organ transplantation recipients.

Association: Allele G is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: EHR-linked and EHR-based phenotyping methods were used to study common variants within FMO5. Efficacy was assessed by A1c levels extracted from EHR records. The SNP was marginally significant after correction for multiple testing.

Association: Genotypes CT + TT is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: Post-transplant diabetes mellitus (PTDM). No significant association was seen in multivariate logistic regression when considering either early PTDM (up to 14 days from transplant) or late PTDM (later than 14 days from transplant).

Association: Allele A is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele C.
More Details: The association is described as "nominal significance" in hispanics.

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: EHR-linked and EHR-based phenotyping methods were used to study common variants within FMO5. Efficacy was assessed by A1c levels extracted from EHR records.

Association: Allele A is associated with increased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: Among the tested variants, only rs622342 in SLC22A1 (variously also referred to as "SLC2A1" in the publication) was significantly associated with lower HbA1c in type II diabetes mellitus patients using metformin. Given the nucleotide base description of rs622342 in Table S1 as "C>A", it was assumed that A is the risk allele.

Association: Allele A (assigned as deficiency phenotype) is associated with Hemolysis when treated with glibenclamide in people with Diabetes Mellitus.
More Details: Case study report of a single individual. Genotyped by molecular analysis. Patient had Type 2 diabetes.

Association: Allele C is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: This is the defining SNP of CYP2C9*3

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
Allele C is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: EHR-linked and EHR-based phenotyping methods were used to study common variants within FMO5. Efficacy was assessed by A1c levels extracted from EHR records.

Association: Allele C is associated with increased response to Dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP-4) inhibitors in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele G.
More Details: The SNP was significantly associated with improved response to DPP-4 inhibitors (as assayed by reductions in HbA1c). Most of the patients were on combination anti-diabetic agent (ADA) therapy, but the relationship was only significant for regimens that included DPP-4 (alone or in combination with other ADAs).

Association: Allele C is associated with increased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with hydrochlorothiazide in people with Hypertension as compared to allele G.
More Details:
Caution: this is a C/G SNP in a gene on the minus chromosomal strand. In the paper association is given for the C (minor) allele, which appears to be already shown on the plus chromosomal strand. 
The association is described as "nominal significance" in hispanics

Association: Allele G is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: EHR-linked and EHR-based phenotyping methods were used to study common variants within FMO5. Efficacy was assessed by A1c levels extracted from EHR records.

Association: Allele G is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to allele T.
More Details: No significant association was seen for either early PTDM (up to 14 days from transplant) or late PTDM (later than 14 days from transplant)

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
Allele A is associated with decreased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: EHR-linked and EHR-based phenotyping methods were used to study common variants within FMO5. Efficacy was assessed by A1c levels extracted from EHR records.

Association: Allele G is associated with increased response to Dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP-4) inhibitors in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: The SNP was significantly associated with improved response to DPP-4 inhibitors (as assayed by reductions in HbA1c). Most of the patients were on combination anti-diabetic agent (ADA) therapy, but the relationship was only significant for regimens that included DPP-4 (alone or in combination with other ADAs).

Association: Genotypes AA + CC is associated with increased response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype AC.
More Details: The AC genotype was associated with increased response to sulfonylureas (a greater than or equal to 7% decrease in Hb1Ac levels at least 3 months after beginning treatment).

Association: CYP2C19 *17/*17 is associated with decreased likelihood of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with clozapine in people with schizoaffective disorder and Schizophrenia.
Allele A is associated with statin-related myopathy when treated with atorvastatin in people with Diabetes Mellitus, Hypertension and Obesity as compared to allele G.
More Details: Alleles complemented to plus chromosomal strand. While study looked at 76 subjects with severe statin-associated muscle symptoms and 50 statin-tolerant controls, then studied exam sequencing data in RYR1 and CACNA1S, most variants considered pathogenic were at very low frequency and were reported as case series not with statistics for overall risk.

Association: CYP2C8 *3 is associated with decreased response to rosiglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to CYP2C8 *1/*1.
Genotype AA is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with cyclosporine or tacrolimus in people with Transplantation as compared to genotypes AG + GG.
More Details: The AA genotype was associated with an increased risk of new-onset diabetes after transplantation (NODAT) in solid organ transplantation recipients. There was a discovery sample (patients received either tacrolimus or cyclosporine), and two replication samples from the Swiss Transplant Cohort Study (STCS; patients received tacrolimus, cyclosporine or neither). Significant associations were seen in the discovery sample, the STCS first replication sample when only patients who received tacrolimus and had a deceased donor were considered, in the second replication sample when all patients were considered, and in the combined analysis when only patients who received tacrolimus and had a decreased donor were considered. In the combined STCS analysis, results were only significant in non-kidney transplant patients (kidney transplant patients p=0.62, OR=0.87 (0.5-1.52)).

Association: Genotype CT is associated with increased response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes CC + TT.
More Details: The CT genotype was associated with increased response to sulfonylureas (a greater than or equal to 7% decrease in Hb1Ac levels at least 3 months after beginning treatment).

Association: Allele C is associated with increased likelihood of Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension and Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele T.
More Details: No SNPs in the GWAS met the threshold for Bonferroni correction but this had the strongest association. Assumed that minor allele is the risk allele.

Association: Genotype GT is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with liver transplantation as compared to genotype GG.
More Details: No significant association was seen when considering either DONOR or RECIPIENT genotype. New-onset diabetes mellitus (NODM).

Association: CYP3A5 *3/*3 is associated with increased likelihood of nephrotoxicity, Tremor or Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with Kidney Transplantation as compared to CYP3A5 *1/*1 + *1/*3.
More Details:
"In our study, we observed a significant association between the
CYP3A5*3 polymorphism and the occurrence of tacrolimus-related
adverse effects. This polymorphism seemed to be associated with
an increased occurrence of nephrotoxicity, tremors, and posttransplant diabetes. In agreement with our results, a study found
that recipients carrying at least one CYP3A5*1 allele develop less
significant nephrotoxicity than patients with CYP3A5*3/*3
genotype [42]. Patients carrying a CYP3A5*1 allele, with lower
C0, seem less exposed to tacrolimus; which probably protects
them against nephrotoxicity" "After adjusting for potential confounding factors (sex, smoking,
alcohol, diabetes, recipient age, MPA and co-medication), a lower
occurrence of nephrotoxicity, tremor and new-onset diabetes
associated with CYP3A5*1 allele ((OR = 0.70, 95% CI: 0.51–0.98,
p = 0.03); (OR = 0.57, 95%: 0.36–0.90, p = 0.01); (OR = 0.44, 95% CI:
0.25–0.74, p = 0.002) respectively)"

Association: Genotype GG is associated with increased risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with Thiazides, plain as compared to genotypes CC + CG.
More Details: This variant was referred to in the study as ACE G4656C or 4656+CT, and it was stated that the G corresponds to the deleted allele, and the C with the insertion allele. The study compared GG genotype OR; 2.49 (1.65-3.75)  p<0.05, with the CC/CG genotypes OR; 1.38 (1.08-1.78) p<0.05 and showed that carriers of GG had a significantly higher risk. The risk of GG carriers increased further when the defined daily dose was 1 or more: OR; 3.07 (1.94-4.84) p<0.05.

Association: Genotype GT is associated with increased response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).  When comparing the response rates between patients with the GT versus TT genotypes, the GT genotypes were associated with a greater frequency of response (52.94% versus 12.7% p=0.001) as well as a greater decrease in HbA1c% as compared to patients with the TT genotype (1.15 versus 0.52 p=0.001). Logistic regression analysis showed that rs2241766 GT genotype was associated with response to pioglitazone. *Please note: there were no individuals of genotype GG.

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: This is the defining SNP of CYP2C9*2

Association: Genotype ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC is associated with increased response to captopril in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotypes ATACAGTCACTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTGAGACGGAGTCTCGCTCTGTCGCCC/del + del/del.
More Details: Reduction in mean arterial blood pressure and albuminuria was significantly greater in those with the ATA.../ATA... genotype compared to the remaining genotypes. No significant differences in change of serum creatinine was seen between the groups. Patients were treated with captopril for 6 months.

Association: Allele C is not associated with Cough when treated with Ace Inhibitors, Plain in people with Asthma, Diabetes Mellitus, Heart Failure, Hypertension and Pulmonary Disease, Chronic Obstructive as compared to allele T.
Genotypes GT + TT are not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to genotype TT.
More Details: Response was defined as "any decrease greater than (or equal to) 15%" of glycated hemoglobin (HbA1C%).

Association: Allele T is not associated with response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele C.
More Details: Treatment success was defined as 1) achieving HbA1c <7 % and 2) absolute reduction in HbAlc after 6-months of metformin therapy. The relationships between genotypes and outcomes were evaluated using multivariate logistic and linear models.

Association: Allele C is not associated with decreased hemoglobin levels when exposed to glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: Fasting blod sample was drawn to determine hemoglobin (A1c) levels. HbA1c was determined with immunoturbodimetric hemolytic automated analysis.

Association: Allele C is not associated with decreased hemoglobin levels when exposed to glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: Fasting blod sample was drawn to determine hemoglobin (A1c) levels. HbA1c was determined with immunoturbodimetric hemolytic automated analysis/.

Association: CYP2C8 *3 is not associated with response to pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to CYP2C8 *1/*1.
Genotype CG is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with liver transplantation as compared to genotype GG.
More Details: No significant association was seen when considering either DONOR or RECIPIENT genotype. New-onset diabetes mellitus (NODM).

Association: Allele C is not associated with dose of glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
Allele C is not associated with dose of glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
CYP2C8 *3 is not associated with Weight gain when treated with pioglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to CYP2C8 *1/*1.
Allele C is not associated with risk of Hypoglycemia when treated with glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele A.
More Details: The authors report that the C allele is not associated with the number of hypoglycemic events per patient over a period of three months when looking at the whole group (N=156) or when looking at the subset of patients over 60 (N=103). Patients reported blood glucose levels once a week, and if they had signs or symptoms of hypoglycemic events.Hypoglycemia was defined according to the American Diabetes Association symptoms and confirmed by blood glucose measurement of less than 3.9 mmol/l.

Association: Allele C is not associated with dose of glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
CYP2C8 *3 is associated with decreased Weight gain when treated with rosiglitazone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to CYP2C8 *1/*1.
Allele del is not associated with response to sulfonamides, urea derivatives in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele GAT.
More Details: described as Met420Del in paper.

Association: Genotype CT is not associated with risk of Diabetes Mellitus when treated with tacrolimus in people with liver transplantation as compared to genotype CC.
More Details: No significant association was seen when considering either DONOR or RECIPIENT genotype. New-onset diabetes mellitus (NODM).

Association: Allele C is not associated with risk of Hypoglycemia when treated with glibenclamide, gliclazide, glimepiride, glipizide and gliquidone in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: The authors report that the C allele is not associated with the number of hypoglycemic events per patient over a period of three months when looking at the whole group (N=156) or when looking at the subset of patients over 60 (N=103). Patients reported blood glucose levels once a week, and additionally noted if they had signs or symptoms of hypoglycemic events. Hypoglycemia was defined according to the American Diabetes Association symptoms and confirmed by blood glucose measurement of less than 3.9 mmol/l.

Association: Allele C is associated with increased response to metformin in people with Diabetes Mellitus as compared to allele T.
More Details: The C allele of rs8192675 was associated with a 0.17% (P = 6.6 × 10-14) greater metformin-induced reduction in hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) in 10,577 participants of European ancestry.

Patients reported blood glucose levels once a week, and if they had signs or symptoms of hypoglycemic events. Hypoglycemia was defined according to the American Diabetes Association symptoms and confirmed by blood glucose measurement of less than 3.9 mmol/l.
